Learners with this badge have independently demonstrated the the entire 3D printing process.

badge_template_activities.title: Interpretative: Identify and talk about the main idea and key information in short straightforward informational and fictional texts.
Interpretative: Identify and talk about the mail message in various time frames in straightforward, and sometimes descriptive, paragraph-length informational texts.
Interpretive: Identify and talk about the main idea and key information in short straightforward conversations.
Interpretative: Participate in conversations and discussions by reacting to the main idea and flow of events expressed in various time frames.
Written: Write about the main message of paragraph-length informational and fictional texts, in which various time frames are used.
Interpersonal: Exchange information in conversations on familiar topics and some researched topics, creating sentences and series of sentences and asking a variety of follow-up questions.

Interpersonal: Exchange information in conversations and some discussions on a variety of familiar topics, including some concrete topics that I have researched, using connected sentences that may combine in form paragraphs and asking a variety of questions, often across various time frames.
Interpersonal: Interact with others to meet my needs in a variety of familiar situations, creating sentences and series of sentences and asking a variety of follow-up questions.

Interpersonal: Interact with others to meet my needs in a variety of situations, sometimes involving a complication, using connected sentences that may combine to form paragraphs and asking a variety of questions, often across various time frames.

Interpersonal: Exchange preferences, feelings or opinions and provide basis advice on a variety of familiar topics, creating sentences and series of sentences and asking a variety of follow-up questions.

Interpersonal: Explain preferences, opinions, and emotions and provide advice on a variety of familiar and some concrete topics that I have researched, using connected sentences that may combine to form paragraphs and asking a variety of questions, often across various time frames

Writing/Reading: Exchange information through written correspondence on a variety of familiar topics, including some concrete topics that I have researched, using connected sentences that may combine to form paragraphs and asking a variety of questions, often across various time frames.
Presentational: Tell a story about my life, activities, events and other social experiences, using sentences and series of connected sentences.
Presentational: Tell stories about school and community events and personal experiences, using a few short paragraphs, often across various times frames.
Presentational: State my view point about familiar topics and give some reasons to support it, using sentences and series of connected sentences.
Presentational: State my viewpoint on familiar or researched topics and provide reasons to support it using a few short paragraphs, often across various times frames.
Presentational: Give straightforward presentations on a variety of familiar topics and some concrete topics I have researched, using sentences and series of connected sentences.
Presentational: Give detailed presentations on a variety of familiar topics I have researched, using sentences and series of connected sentences.
Writing: Write stories about community events and personal experiences, using a few short paragraphs, often across various time frames.
Intercultural: Compare products and practices related to everyday life and personal interest or studies, in my own and other cultures.
Intercultural: Converse with peers from the target culture in familiar situations at school, work, or play, and show interest in basic cultural similarities and differences.
Intercultural: Model an understanding that significant differences in behaviors exist among cultures by using appropriate learned behaviors and avoiding major social blunders.
